page.title: 11Farming in the Area
page.content: The farming in North Luffenham and Edith Weston is mixed. The nature of the land in this area varies and this determines the land use. Many farmers prefer to use their poorer land for sheep or rough grazing. The farmer interviewed uses his land for growing barley but he does have some grazing for the bullocks he fattens for market.Other village farmers utilize their arable land for cereal,silage and root crops. Our farmer works about 100 acres and finds no need to employ extra workers except at harvest time.The spare time that he has throughout the year is spent on farm and machinery maintenance. To supplement his income, he keeps hens and grows fruit and vegetables.In this area the farmers live in the original farm houses,some of which date back to the 15th Century.
